intro: Trigonostemon oliganthus, commonly known as the small-flowered trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
